programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi bids for an expensive locker, not knowing what it contains, while Darrell Sheets returns to town with money to burn.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: After test-driving the infamous OJ Simpson Bronco, Rick Harrison must decide whether to purchase this million-dollar item. Plus, a rare silverware set and a 1978 Star Wars comic come under consideration.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth notices that Ashley is behaving strangely - either low-balling on, or rejecting outright, various items that she would otherwise give higher deals on.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley continues to low-ball and mistreat customers to Seth's detriment, and gets involved in an argument in front of a client over a signed 1970 Detroit Tigers baseball.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick restores a classic guitar for Brettly's birthday, and a rare hunting scooter arrives in the shop.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The team is hired to restore a very important sign, and Pawn Stars' Rick Harrison brings in a unique vending machine.

programme.title: Nightmare in Suburbia
programme.desc: The story of Annabelle, who by day was a typical schoolgirl but by night was the sex slave of a Satanic cult.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: Police take 10 years to track down the killer of a disabled Denver woman. Was she murdered for her money or was there a more personal motive?.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Mary shows a different side to her personality in Dallas and soon has a roaring crowd on its feet. Meanwhile, Ricky and Bubba are led astray by their latest find.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Fort Worth witnesses a showdown when Cowboy Matt begins throwing his weight around. Jenny's wins a locker containing a very strange item.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick is given a safe that has not been opened in years, and tries to get inside and reveal its mysterious contents.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The team restores an unusual wheelchair made out of parts from a Second World war aircraft, and Kelly has an anniversary surprise for Rick.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A 1930s Gottlieb grip tester arrives at the shop, and Rick Harrison gets hung up on a limited edition piece of abstract art by Hollywood actor Anthony Quinn.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick checks out some vintage Marvel comics, inspiring Chumlee to dig through his own collection to see if he has anything valuable.

programme.title: Hangar 1: The UFO Files
programme.desc: Experts investigate case files that suggest a shadow government exists and operates beyond public and congressional scrutiny to protect and conceal information about UFOs. The documentary exposes the extreme measures taken to protect these secrets from being revealed, and examines the origins of the alleged organisation.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts explore the similarities between huge pyramids across the world, and hypothesise on whether extraterrestrials could have influenced their construction and design.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les's anger over Seth and Ashley's sibling rivalry boils over to the point that he gives them an ultimatum to calm down or be sacked - but they carry on bickering.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les remains in hospital following his collapse, and Seth and Ashley continue manning operations at the pawn shop. However, the bickering continues.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Some of the priciest items in the pawn shop's history, including a $70,000 Panama Pacific gold coin from 1915.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A selection of the best moments from the Pawn Stars' archive, including a Civil War veteran's rifle and a campaign ribbon from Lincoln's first election in 1860

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Bold buyers Brandi, Jarrod, Barry and Dave smoke out the competition with their sharp eyes in California. But who will buy trash and who will find treasure?.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dave risks his money on buying a locker that has not been opened in 20 years, while Barry gets hold of a unique racing car.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders head for the East Texas town of Tyler, where Jenny finds a valuable piece of musical memorabilia - but one of her competitors ends up out of pocket.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Ricky and Bubba try to keep their lucky streak going as the bidders return to old haunts, while Jenny discovers her inner ballerina.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: The bladesmiths are tasked to achieve one of six Damascus patterns for their first round blade, and must choose wisely as the ladder to victory is full of twists as the smiths stack, weld and repeat, trying to forge optimum blades under their specified parameters.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A perfect condition 1923 Babe Ruth baseball card and a not-so-perfect condition 1930s tricycle in need of some TLC are brought into the store.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A 1763 flintlock pistol is brought into the shop and Rick and Chumlee assess some screen-used Star Wars props.

programme.title: Hangar 1: The UFO Files
programme.desc: Contemplating whether the golden age of technology is a testament to the power of the human brain, or has been arrived at thanks to extraterrestrial help.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Ancient astronaut theorists hunt for evidence linking Bigfoot to alien species from the distant past, and ask whether the ape-like creature, which some people believe inhabits forests, could be an extraterrestrial.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth ignores Ashley's wish to ban a troublesome customer - but his decision threatens to put the shop at risk. Meanwhile, Les commissions a striking masterpiece.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth hatches a plan to get more customers through the pawn shop doors. His new idea backfires, and Les is forced to reconsider his choice of manager.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod strains his budget by paying too much for a locker full of toys, while Dave shows off his new truck, but finds his rivals are not impressed.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dave goes head to head with an old rival, who is famous for making one of the most successful purchases in the history of the storage scene.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A look back at some of the Pawn Stars' best vehicular buys, including a classic 1949 Hudson Commodore.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The most famous finds in the shop's history, including a 40-year-old Bob Dylan album and a suit worn by James Brown.

programme.title: World's Toughest Prisons
programme.desc: Go behind the bars of one of Mexico's toughest jails, El Hongo, reputedly controlled by a notorious drug cartel.

programme.title: Spiky Gold Hunters
programme.desc: Dwayne is out to fill a massive order of urchins. However, technical problems, freezing temperatures and the power of the ocean puts the operation in jeopardy.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Bold buyers Brandi, Jarrod, Barry and Dave smoke out the competition with their sharp eyes in California. But who will buy trash and who will find treasure?.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dave risks his money on buying a locker that has not been opened in 20 years, while Barry gets hold of a unique racing car.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and regulars Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons are joined by Josh Widdicombe, Gary Delaney, Tiffany Stevenson and Romesh Ranganathan for the comedy quiz. The panellists give their take on major news stories from July 2014 and participate in a series of stand-up spots and improvised games.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? The Unseen Bits
programme.desc: Rob Brydon, Lee Mack and David Mitchell feature in a special episode of out-takes, looking back over some of the best moments. Among the celebrity guests are Kevin Bishop, Warwick Davis, Romesh Ranganathan, Hugh Dennis, Sara Cox and Brian Blessed.

programme.title: The Misadventures of Romesh Ranganathan
programme.desc: The comedian visits countries that are rarely visited by tourists to get a sense of the local culture and find out if they deserve their reputation. His first destination is Haiti, a country mostly famous for a dictatorship and a series of natural disasters. Accompanied by journalist Jeremy Dupin, he visits the iron market, attends vodou ceremonies, and explores a cathedral destroyed by an earthquake.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts the quiz with a difference as comedians Sara Pascoe and Johnny Vegas and former MP Ed Balls join regular panellist Alan Davies. to answer questions about subjects associated with various parts.

programme.title: Asian Provocateur
programme.desc: Romesh Ranganathan visits Canada for a family reunion and starts by helping out his seven-year-old cousin in a breakdancing performance at the local primary school.

programme.title: Zapped
programme.desc: Brian is accused of starting a war, and the only way he can prove his innocence is through trial by combat.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: Vintage comedy, with sketches including Done to Death. Plus, music by Georgie Fame and Alan Price.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: Henry Ford's plan, with the help of Albert Kahn, to build a giant factory in Michigan, covering 3.5million sq ft and including an aircraft production line half a mile in length.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Documentary exploring unusual rail networks from around the world, beginning with a look at trains in cities, including an inverted monorail in Wuppertal, Germany. With contributions from Susana Esteves da Fonseca.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: The comedian attempts to zigzag his way 1,200 miles through Kenya and Tanzania, beginning this leg of his journey on a vintage steam locomotive designed in Glasgow. On a cattle farm established by an aristocrat a century ago, he dons a pair of overalls and joins workers as they bathe more than 2,000 animals to ward off parasites and biting flies. Later, in the vast Tsavo East National Park, he bottle-feeds orphaned elephant calves, before visiting a Maasai village - where he quickly regrets a faux pas during a meat feast.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: The wilderness lines that have pushed the frontiers of human endeavour into previously unknown territories, solving a set of complex problems along the way.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: The documentary exploring historical mysteries returns, beginning with Jamie Theakston looking at the lost city of Petra in Jordan. The presenter questions whether any treasures still lie beneath the site in hidden tombs, and enlists the help of local historians.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The story of German architect Albert Speer, one of the only war criminals to accept his guilt during the Nuremberg trials, although there were doubts about the scale of his remorse.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: Henry Ford's plan, with the help of Albert Kahn, to build a giant factory in Michigan, covering 3.5million sq ft and including an aircraft production line half a mile in length.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.desc: Documentary looking at railroads constructed during history's most turbulent periods, now associated with some of mankind's ugliest deeds. Beginning with the Trans-Pyrenees Railway.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: An underground city beneath a forest in Northern France built to house 3,000 people, an ice cave under Iceland's biggest glacier, and a subterranean power station in London.

programme.title: The Railway: First Great Western
programme.desc: The small, picturesque seaside station at Dawlish in Devon is brought to life by an influx of people attending an air show, and the company lays on extra staff, schedules more trains and employs different queuing systems to cope with all the passengers. At Bath Spa, gate-line operator Peter Eagle tries his hand at foreign languages as he directs international tourists to and from the ancient city.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek collects a Jaguar Mark 2 and explains why they made such poor getaway cars for 1960s bank robbers. A customer considers a Morris Marina as a Christmas present for his wife.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.desc: Documentary looking at railroads constructed during history's most turbulent periods, now associated with some of mankind's ugliest deeds. Beginning with the Trans-Pyrenees Railway.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: The underground bases built by the German army during the occupation of Jersey, and a group of more than 20 underground cities in Turkey, one of which dates back to 800BC.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The search for Josef Mengele, one of the most wanted Nazi war criminals, which was led by Holocaust survivor Simon Wiesenthal.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The sabotaging efforts of Peugeot in Nazi-occupied France, where the bosses and workers cooperated closely with the Resistance to hinder the use of military vehicles by the Nazis.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.desc: An exploration of the Harz Mountain Railway in Germany - Europe's longest rail network - which still uses steam locomotives and has a murky, hidden past.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A marooned ironclad structure off the coast of England that hides a dramatic story of war and resilience, and a facility in the heart of America that helped tear apart a nation.

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: Alan Price and Georgie Fame guest on the vintage comedy show, starring Messrs Barker and Corbett.

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: Vintage comedy, with sketches including Done to Death. Plus, music by Georgie Fame and Alan Price.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Roy Clarke's comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason. Tight-fisted shopkeeper Arkwright purchases fire-damaged stock, only to find all the tins have lost their labels.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville tries to persuade Arkwright to buy a van, as he is fed up with having to struggle doing the rounds with the shop's outdated delivery bike. He is pleasantly surprised when his skinflint uncle agrees - until he takes the vehicle out on the road. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: The team is assigned to protect murderer Susan Kellar, whose recent release from jail has provoked a storm of protest and forced her to go into hiding for her own safety. Unfortunately, they find themselves unable to protect her family from the lethal attentions of a vigilante. Feature-length crime drama, starring James Macpherson.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Stuart 'Recall' McKenzie joins Blue Watch, and there are a series of incidents involving schoolchildren on their half-term break.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Finding himself in dire financial straits, Lovejoy borrows Â£100,000 from a loan shark using his daughter Viki's flat as security. Unfortunately the deal backfires, and he's forced to use every ounce of his ingenuity to ensure they both emerge unscathed. Frank Finlay guest stars, with Ian McShane.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits a Japanese-style horticultural haven in St Mawgan, Cornwall - open to the public under the National Gardens Scheme - complete with oriental plants including bamboo and bonsai.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Tony is hauled over the coals for smuggling rifles into Britain, and Fitzpatrick blows his top on the eve of McCleod's funeral, angry that disillusioned widow Angela is not allowing it to be done with full military honours.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Drysdale's superiors blame him for McCleod's death, Fitzpatrick is turned down for promotion, and Andy's attempt to prove himself gets Jacko into trouble.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Leela and Sheelagh find themselves at odds over the suspicious death of a baby when it seems accusations of abuse directed at the infant's asylum-seeker parents could be fuelled by racism. Honey accuses Amber of trying to ruin her relationship with Steve - then displays breathtaking hypocrisy by falling into bed with Scott Burnett. Neil's day goes from bad to worse as Phil taunts him about his disgraced father-in-law and Andrea returns to the station, only to plant a kiss on Smithy.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Zubin gives evidence at the inquest into Dominic Fryer's death, where his personal conflicts with Ric are called into question and he is left reconsidering his future. However, on his return to the hospital he discovers a potentially lethal mishap with the oxygen supply and has to race against time to save a patient's life. News of Diane's pregnancy spreads across the wards, but she faces a difficult choice when Connie offers her a prestigious research position. Chrissie warns Owen the baby changes nothing - his relationship is still a terrible mistake.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: The Accident and Emergency department is plunged into darkness by a power cut, leaving a girl terrified and Elliot struggling with his own private dilemmas. Charlie and Baz have also parted company, but out of the gloom of broken relationships Mark and George finally admit their love for each other. Popular medical drama, starring Peter Guinness, Derek Thompson and Rebecca Lacey, with a guest appearance by former Doctor Who Colin Baker.

credits.actor: a guest appearance by former Doctor Who Colin Baker

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: A Friday night shift proves a hectic time for the Sun Hill coppers as a childhood friend of Amber's is raped, a drug-dealer is collared and a mugging victim is attacked for a second time - and in the aftermath of all the excitement, Phil's unruly hormones are fired by an encounter with a fellow sex addict. A guilt-ridden Honey decides to tell Steve their relationship is over, Neil pours out his heart to Andrea, and Yvonne learns she's no longer Acting Sergeant - leading to much speculation about her replacement.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Ian seeks a desperate solution to his cashflow problems. Rachel has to face up to her mother and the past. A man from the council has bad news for the squatters.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Richard has a surprise for Rachel, while Sharon plans a controversial evening of entertainment. Early morning visitors at the squat cause a commotion in Albert Square.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Two youths break into a boat moored in a marina and cause an explosion on board, and as a result the Blue Watch team face a race against time to save the crew of a sinking yacht.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The antiques dealer agrees to buy a 19th-century dresser for Â£65, and finds it is worth Â£20,000 - but unfortunately, he is not the only one who knows its true value and Beth is conned into parting with it. Ian McShane and Diane Parish star.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim's complex investigation into the death of a sailor is further hampered by the arrival of a bright, shrewd police officer.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Joey gets closer to Roxy, who has left home after rowing with her husband Stan, while Lilo Lil brings Freddie home with a broken leg.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Jeffrey has one too many to drink, and has to be escorted back to his chalet by Gladys. However, Barry and Yvonne witness the spectacle and conclude the two are enjoying an illicit relationship. Comedy, starring Simon Cadell and Ruth Madoc.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel and Jean take care of Stephen while Penny goes into hospital for a routine operation - but their task is complicated by a case of mistaken identity. Geoffrey Palmer, Judi Dench and Moira Brooker star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Alvin dresses as a crow, but finds it difficult to walk in a straight line, and the disguise gives Howard an idea as he tries to hide from Pearl. Long-running comedy, starring Peter Sallis, Frank Thornton, Brian Murphy and Robert Fyfe.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: A doctor is accused of murdering a seriously ill patient with a morphine overdose, a case which echoes a dilemma in Deed's personal life and sets him on the path to potential ruin. Meanwhile, Charlie's HIV-positive friend finds herself in danger of losing her baby to Social Services, and calls on the judge for help. Drama, starring Martin Shaw and Jenny Seagrove.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team is asked to reinvestigate the 1975 death of a union leader, whose body was found in the Thames. As the detectives delve deeper into the case, a financial scandal involving misappropriated funds is uncovered and a Labour peer points the finger of suspicion at the victim's deputy, but Brian's increasingly erratic behaviour threatens to hamper the inquiry. Frances Barber, Kenneth Cranham and Dave Hill guest star.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: The murder of a woman thrown from a bridge appears motiveless until the team is led to a microchip factory where her husband works. Drama, starring James MacPherson, John Michie and Blythe Duff, with Brian Capron, who later rose to fame as serial killer Richard Hillman in Coronation Street and Lovejoy veteran Caroline Langrishe.

credits.actor: who later rose to fame as serial killer Richard Hillman in Coronation Street

programme.title: The BRITs at 40
programme.desc: Jack Whitehall narrates a look back at the history of the awards ceremony, featuring archive footage of some of the most memorable moments, from Oasis and Blur's rivalry to Stormzy's attack on the government, and classic performances by Adele, Rihanna and Drake. The programme also recalls less successful moments, from the infamous 1989 ceremony hosted by Mick Fleetwood and Sam Fox, and Madonna struggles with her cape. Featuring interviews with stars including Robbie Williams, Mel B, Mick Fleetwood, Little Mix, Sam Smith, Ellie Goulding, Sharon Osbourne, Bros, Dua Lipa, Rick Astley and Tom Jones.

programme.title: Best Walks with a View with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: An exploration of scenic Britain on foot, beginning in north Wales where she heads out beside the Menai Straits overlooking Snowdonia. During the trek, Julia seeks out the lost prototype of the first ever Land Rover, which locals believe may be buried in the Anglesey sand-dunes where its inventor first put it through trials almost 70 years ago. The expert walker also discovers why Prince William and his wife have a soft spot for the romantic St Llanddwyn Island, home to the Welsh St Valentine. Finally, she meets mussel and oyster pickers, getting to taste their wares in a sunset beach picnic.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: More celebrity interviews and topical debate from a female perspective.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Christine is in court on behalf of herself and her brother to claim Â£4,800 for their share of the rent on their late grandfather's property.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which a team of five called Young's Offenders answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge. Then they try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a Â£10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants who have never met before pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Long-running soap following the ups and downs of village life amid the rolling scenery of the Yorkshire Dales.

programme.title: Australia with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: Presenter Julia Bradbury continues her epic journey across Australia, exploring all four corners as she finds out about the continent and the people who live there. Her next step is the Blue Mountains, a rugged region in New South Wales. Along the way she has a go at paddle boarding with pooches, meets Australia's favourite koala and has a chat with fashion designer Jenny Kee. She also takes a ride on the world's steepest railway, and her hike through the mountains ends with a sighting of the bowerbird.

programme.title: The BRIT Awards 2020
programme.desc: Jack Whitehall hosts the 40th edition of the annual music awards. Stormzy, Michael Kiwanuka, Lewis Capaldi, Dave and Harry Styles are in the running for Album of the Year, while Celeste has been announced as the recipient of this year's Rising Star Award. The show will feature performances from Mabel, Harry Styles, Stormzy, Billie Eilish, Lewis Capaldi and Celeste.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How to churn out Wensleydale cheese, turn pig hair into the world's finest paintbrushes, and distil aromatic oils from eucalyptus.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Edd China revisit a variety of cars from the archives, including old vehicles that just would not start, and a few classics that stole the show.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: A 727 2cam Ferrari owned by the heirs of the Parker Pen is inspected in Maryland, along with a Thunderbird convertible.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini purchases a 1941 Ford Woody, with only 15,000 miles on the clock.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Part one of two. Hollywood star Bill Murray commissions a bike based on his character in the film Caddyshack, to be auctioned at a charity golf competition.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Gray brings his 1929 Phaeton in because of gas smells and cracking sounds. When Dan digs into the car, he uncovers deadly dangers that lead to life-saving repairs.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: The intrepid Mike Rowe takes to the waters of Alaska aboard a fish-processing ship, where he is faced with the challenge of bleeding and gutting the day's catch.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.sub-title: Rolled Wafers/Wood Pellets/Class and Championship Rings
programme.desc: The processes used to make rolled wafers and wood pellets, as well as class and championship rings.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The production of speed skates, cocoa beans, bulk chocolate and synthetic rubber.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A visit to Spain to see one of the most advanced and powerful planes in the world. Plus, the secret to making warm waterproof boots and how bananas get 'just ripe'.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The lives of Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz, two of America's most skilled 'pickers', who travel around the country trawling junk yards, garages, attics and barns for precious objects. In the middle of a Minnesota blizzard Mike and Frank face the frost to uncover a rare pair of trucks on farmer Jim's spread.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The crab fishing fleet heads back out to sea, but the Northwestern is forced to lag behind to make some urgent repairs.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: Three teams of miners dive under the ice to dredge for gold on the floor of the Bering Sea.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Steve Grahame hits the mud, Cameron's journey gets hotter and harder, and Sludge's mountain mission takes a downhill slide.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: Trading Up
programme.desc: Starting with a cheap runabout, Mike Brewer goes on a worldwide mission to trade up his vehicles in a bid to acquire a supercar. He begins in Australia with a Ford Falcon Futura AU II.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini tries to find the original owner of an abandoned 1972 Ferrari Daytona Spyder.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini checks out a valuable collection of vehicles found in an avocado field. Meanwhile, a fellow enthusiast makes a rare find.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The lives of Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz, two of America's most skilled 'pickers', who travel around the country trawling junk yards, garages, attics and barns for precious objects. In the middle of a Minnesota blizzard Mike and Frank face the frost to uncover a rare pair of trucks on farmer Jim's spread.

programme.title: Railroad Alaska
programme.desc: Some off-grid settlers face being stranded without basic necessities when an avalanche blocks the track. Hugh battles the weather to fix the track and deliver propane.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The crews plough on, determined to stake a claim to the most coveted fishing grounds, but the sea proves as difficult as ever, and after just 48 hours, one greenhorn shows signs of cracking under the strain.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: Tensions among the crews mount as Zeke loses his cool and Steve fights for his job.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard is blown away by an 18th-century mansion on the edge of the Yorkshire Moors, and goes deep below ground at a Liverpool cathedral to unearth religious artefacts.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Husband-and-wife team Nick and Jo face tough driving conditions with volatile cargo. Plus, Yogi makes a costly mistake during a two-week stint on the road.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Edd China revisit a variety of cars from the archives, including old vehicles that just would not start, and a few classics that stole the show.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys uncover toy cars worth as much as the real thing, and a stash of custom motorbikes with an incredible backstory.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard hunts for valuable items on an old family estate, steps back in time at a 1920s-themed hotel, and uncovers tiny treasures at an antiques wholesaler.

programme.title: Born Mucky: Life on the Farm
programme.desc: Ian's cattle face an important day as they are tested for bovine tuberculosis. Ally uses Viking woodcraft skills to build a fence for his new camping side business.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Resident ceramicist Kirsten Ramsey painstakingly puts the broken bits of a shattered vase by Jean Lurcat, a contemporary of Picasso's, back together again. A precious 19th-century Italian chair and a very special jewellery box are also restored. Narrated by Bill Paterson.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The experts take on the challenges of restoring three cherished family heirlooms, bringing back to life a painting, a ceramic plaque and a Japanese lacquered jewellery box.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How it is possiblle to build the 700 horsepower Tesla Model S, turn horses' tails into fine fabrics, and clean the largest swimming pools in the world.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How France's appetite for snails is sated, how slabs of steel are turned into shiny cutlery, and how to craft a kayak you can paddle with your feet.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Zabrina looks for an extravagant ball gown for her wedding, while Cheryl is nervous about seeing her custom dress for the first time.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: A bride faces opposition from her sister and sister-in-law over her choice of gown, while another customer knows what she wants, but fears her mother will not agree.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: An unusual patient turns up in the form of an albino echidna, and Chris is invited to Symbio Wildlife Park to carry out a highly dangerous procedure on a female Sumatran tiger.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: A woman is forced to face the facts about the high number of cats that she shares her residence with. Meanwhile, a dog owner is turning a blind eye to his pet's suffering.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Raging wildfires threaten the SPCA's stables and the horses become agitated. Meanwhile, the officers enter a house that displays the classic signs of neglect.

programme.title: Celebrity Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore and Jay Blades scour the homes of Louise Minchin and Chris Hollins for items they can transform and sell on to raise money for charity.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How arson investigators gather physical evidence and mount undercover and sting operations to crack insurance torchings and instances of murder.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Liz and John Calvert, who vanished in March 2008 from Hilton Head Island, South Carolina, where they ran a boating resort business. Shortly before they went missing some financial discrepancies were found in their bank accounts, and suspicion fell on their accountant Dennis Gerwing - who committed suicide a day after being named a person of interest in relation to their disappearance.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 22-year-old Bradyn Fuksa, who vanished in July 2009 after taking a mysterious 10-hour journey from Kansas to Wyoming before abandoning his vehicle.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Social media superstar Claudia Oshry hits Kleinfeld with her opinionated sisters, and Baton Rouge bride Kelli Hutchinson gets the surprise of a lifetime.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bodybuilder wants a dress that makes her look big, and a bride plots an elaborate wedding at the Grand Canyon.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: My Sisters Are Picking Out My Dress!
programme.desc: A bride lets her sisters plan her wedding, and a demanding customer has a big budget to spend.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: This Is My FiancÃ© and This Is His Wife!
programme.desc: The team is stunned when Jennifer brings her fiance - and his wife. Meanwhile, Amanda Barrasso seeks a dress fit for an ice queen.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard does battle at a castle in Essex, drives a hard bargain on automobile memorabilia, and an antiques emporium in Berkshire holds anatomical interest.

programme.title: Celebrity Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore and Jay Blades scour the homes of Louise Minchin and Chris Hollins for items they can transform and sell on to raise money for charity.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Part two of two. Lupe's relationship feels the strain after her painful skin removal surgery. Meanwhile, Ashley's rapid weight loss leads to medical complications.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Following the lives of people, each weighing over 600lbs. Through their year-long journeys, they attempt to lose thousands of pounds collectively, to survive.

programme.title: FBI Case Files
programme.desc: Agents investigate the death of a pregnant woman who is found dead with her unborn child removed from her body.
